results.title: Five minutes to live = Door-to-door maniac
results.creator_credit: Bill Karn, James Ellsworth and Flower Films
results.brief_description: Country singer icon Johnny Cash made a rare film appearance in this 1960s thriller playing a brutal New Jersey gangster, named Johnny. When his cohort Fred devises a plan to keep the wife of a bank vice-president hostage for ransom, Johnny proceeds to terrorise her with taunts and threats. Unbeknownst to the robbers, the marriage is in a fragile state, with the husband planning to leave that very evening. As well as being an effective crime drama, “Five minutes to live” also satirises the banality of suburban life and the middle-class American lifestyle. Also stars Merle Travis.

results.title: Five billion years
results.creator_credit: Joyce Borenstein, Derek Lamb, David Verrall and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This superbly animated science film traces the evolution of North America from the Earth’s geophysical beginnings, through the genesis of the first living organisms, right up to the arrival of humans. Radiant colors and smooth-flowing animation evoke sizzling lava rivers, oceans bursting with life, and freezing ice ages. The film provides an excellent view of the time frame within which these remarkable events took place and highlights the fact that, relatively speaking, we are newcomers to Planet Earth. (Awards: Houston)

results.title: Pot luck
results.creator_credit: Ossie Emery, Betti Wood and Pilgrim Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fisherman’s World”.
An unplanned fishing trip, looking for likely fishing spots and taking pot luck. Fish caught include flathead, small baitfish and jewfish.

results.title: The Rockhoppers
results.creator_credit: Ossie Emery, Betti Wood and Pilgrim Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fisherman’s World”.
Ron Calcutt discusses the do’s and dont’s of rock fishing for blackfish along the coast of Australia. He points out the need for special care in this exciting sport due to the unpredictable weather and tidal conditions, which cause many people to lose their lives by drowning.

results.title: Fishing the lake country
results.creator_credit: Ossie Emery, Betti Wood, ABC and Pilgrim Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Fisherman’s World”.
Ron Calcutt shows some attractive fishing spots in Sydney and Mallacoota before going to the Gippsland Lakes. All through the film he gives hints on fishing, as well as discussing the ups and downs of the sport.

results.title: Fishermen of Pubnico
results.creator_credit: Leonard Forest, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A film story about the people who live in the nine fishing villages of Pubnico on the southwest tip of the Nova Scotian peninsula. Like that of their Acadian ancestors, their livelihood is inextricably bound to the sea. Characteristic of their faith in its bounty is the quest of the captain of a fishing schooner who, after a fruitless three-week search for swordfish, borrows money and sets out again. Eight more days of scanning the waves are rewarded by a full catch and money in the pocket for the captain and his crew.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Leonard Forest, Victor Jobin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: Fists in the pocket = I pugni in tasca
results.creator_credit: Marco Bellocchio, Enzo Doria and Doria Film
results.brief_description: This bizarre drama chronicles the strange activities of a blind widow living with her four children - Augusto, Sandro, Leone and Giulia. The burden of supporting the family falls on Augusto, the only one of the four not afflicted with epilepsy. When Sandro determines to help Augusto break away and marry his girlfriend, he can see only one way to do it; and sets out to kill the rest of his family. Accompanied by a powerful film score by Ennio Morricone. In Italian with English subtitles.

results.title: Fisherman's gamble
results.creator_credit: Ray Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: A sea hunt for swordfish off the Nova Scotia coast. A swordfish is more like a torpedo than a fish and, with five feet of boat-piercing armour for a nose, it is almost as deadly. Catching one is an exciting test of strength, with some anxious moments.
